analyzed: de'i cho sgra brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid mi rtag par sgrub pa'i mthun pa'i phyogs bum pa dang glog dang nags kyi me tog la sogs pa mi rtag pa thams cad la brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid ces bya bas khyab par bya dgos pa
translated: then in order to prove that what is arisen from effort alone is impermanent, he would have to pervade all impermanent things, such as pots, lightning, and forest flowers, with the term ‚Äúarisen from effort alone.‚Äù

original: la bum pa la brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid yod kyang /
analyzed: la bum pa la brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid yod kyang /

analyzed: rtog ge pa mkhas pas ni gang dang gang brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid yin pa de dang de thams cad ni mi rtag pa kho na'o zhes nges par gzung ba bya bas /
translated: The learned logicians should definitely accept that whatever is produced immediately upon the exertion of an agent is impermanent.

original: des na sgra brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid mi rtag par sgrub pa'i mthun pa'i phyogs bum pa yang brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid yin pas de yang mi rtag go zhes sgrub pa'i tshe /

original: mthun pa'i phyogs nam mkha' dang nags kyi me tog la sogs pa la brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid kyis khyab pa ma yin du zin kyang brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid ces bya ba phyogs kyi chos de gtan tshigs nyid du 'dod pa dang 'dra
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs nam mkha' dang nags kyi me tog la sogs pa la brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid kyis khyab pa ma yin du zin kyang brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid ces bya ba phyogs kyi chos de gtan tshigs nyid du 'dod pa dang 'dra
translated: When this is proven, although space and forest flowers and so on are similar instances in which being produced immediately upon the exertion of an agent does not pervade them, it is as if they assert that being produced immediately upon the exertion of an agent is the property of the subject that is the reason.

analyzed: bas kho bo'i gtan tshigs bya ba dang ldan pa nyid kyang de dang 'dra bas khyed kyi klan ka de bzang po ma yin no //

analyzed: mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: bya ba dang ldan pa nyid la yang 'gro ba dgag pa'i phyir /

analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /

analyzed: dper na brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid ni mi rtag pa kho na'o zhes nges par gzung bas khyab pa ma yin yang @246a * //

analyzed: phyogs kyi chos gtan tshigs nyid du 'dod pa dang 'dra bar 'dir yang bya ba dang ldan pa nyid mi 'gro ba kho na'o zhes nges par gzung pas khyab pa ma yin yang phyogs kyi chos gtan tshigs nyid du rung pa'i phyir /
translated: Similarly, here, although it is not ascertained that ‚Äúonly that which possesses activity is not going,‚Äù since the property of the subject is suitable as a reason,

analyzed: kho bo'i gtan tshigs kyi don bya ba dang ldan pa nyid ces bya ba de ma grub pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: the meaning of my reason, ‚Äúthat which possesses activity,‚Äù is not unestablished.

analyzed: ci ste 'gro ba smra ba dag 'di skad ces dbu ma pas sngar / 'gro ba po min 'gro ba min //
translated: The proponents of going may say, ‚ÄúIn the context of the proofüîΩthat one who is not a goer does not go, you Followers of the Middle Way

analyzed: zhes bya ba de sgrub pa'i skabs su don dam par 'gro ba po ma yin pa yang mi 'gro ste /
translated: say, ‚ÄòThat which is not a goer does not go.‚ÄôüîΩYou say, ‚ÄòUltimately, that which is not a goer does not go because it isüîΩdevoid of going, like anything else that is not a goer.‚Äô The reason in thatüîΩsyllogism, ‚Äòis devoid of going,‚Äô is not established, because it is not a property

analyzed: 'gro ba dang bral ba'i phyir de las gzhan pa bzhin no zhes sbyor ba'i tshig smras pa de'i gtan tshigs 'gro ba dang bral ba nyid ces bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs la khyab pa ma yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid de /
translated: of the subject.üîΩThis is because a reason is established as the property of the subject when

analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa dag la med pas mthun pa'i phyogs la khyab pa ma yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes zer na /

analyzed: de la 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dis 'gro ba dang bral ba nyid gtan tshigs yin par yang lan btab pa yin no zhes go bar byas te bya ba dang ldan pa nyid ces bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no
translated: Here the author of the commentary himself makes it understood that he has responded to this by saying that this is a reason, ‚Äúbecause of being devoid of going,‚Äù and that the meaning of the reason, ‚Äúbecause of possessing activity,‚Äù is not unestablished.

analyzed: 'di skad bstan te / 'gro ba dang bral ba nyid ni mi 'gro ba kho na'o zhes nges par gzung ba de'i phyir te dper na brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid ni mi rtag pa kho na'o zhes nges par gzung bas khyab pa ma yin yang phyogs kyi chos gtan @246b tshigs
translated: This is what is being said:

original: nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is ascertained that ‚Äúthat which is devoid of going‚Äù is only that which does not go, just as it is ascertained that ‚Äúthat which arises in dependence on effort‚Äù is only impermanent, although there is no pervasion, the meaning of the reason is asserted to be the property of the subject.

analyzed: 'gro ba dang bral ba nyid la yang 'gro ba dgag pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Also, in the case of ‚Äúthat which is devoid of going,‚Äù the meaning of the reason is not not established because going is refuted.

analyzed: ci ste sdod pa po ni 'gro ba po ma yin par yang 'gyur la /

analyzed: 'gro ba por yang 'gyur bas sdod pa po khas blangs pas dpe med de /

original: ci ste 'gro ba smra ba dag 'di skad ces dbu ma pas sngar /
analyzed: ci ste 'gro ba smra ba dag 'di skad ces dbu ma pas sngar /
translated: The proponents of going might say, ‚ÄúIn the context of the proof

translated: of the statement ‚ÄòThe goer does not rest,‚Äô

analyzed: zhes bya ba de sgrub pa'i skabs su don dam par 'gro ba po ni mi 'gro ste ;
translated: you Followers of the Middle Way say, ‚ÄòUltimately the goer does not rest,

analyzed: bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir sdod pa po bzhin te zhes sbyor ba'i tshig smras pa /

analyzed: de'i dpe sdod pa po las blangs pa ni dpe ma grub pa nyid de 'di ltar sdod pa po ni dus thams cad sdod pa po nyid du nges pa ma yin te /
translated: The example you use, a sitter, is not established. This is because a sitter is not necessarily a sitter at all times.

analyzed: sdod pa po de lta bu de khyed kyi dpe nyid du khas blangs pas dpe med de /

translated: Though he rests and does not go, he also possesses and goes, because the probandum, the property to be proven, ‚Äúhe does not go‚Äù is not established, since he possesses one part of it.

analyzed: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i cha gnyi ga la grags pas sdod pa po dpe rung ba'i phyir skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Here, the author of the commentary says, ‚ÄúThere is no error because the one who is standing is a suitable example, since both the proponent and opponent agree that he is an instance of the probandum.‚Äù

original: kho bo'i bsgrub par bya ba ni mi 'gro ba yin la /
analyzed: kho bo'i bsgrub par bya ba ni mi 'gro ba yin la /

analyzed: sdod pa po de ji srid du langs te mi 'gro ba de srid du de la mi 'gro ba'i cha rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyi ga la grags pa yod pas /

analyzed: des na sdod pa po de srid du langs te mi 'gro ba de srid du dpe rung ba'i phyir kho bo'i dpe mi 'grub pa'i skyon med do // 'di skad bstan te gal te khyed na re /
translated: Therefore, as long as the one who is standing does not rise and go, for that long the example is suitable. Thus there is no error that our example is not established.

original: sdod pa po de nam zhig na langs te 'gro bar 'gyur bas mi 'gro ba'i dpe mi rung ngo zhes zer na /
analyzed: sdod pa po de nam zhig na langs te 'gro bar 'gyur bas mi 'gro ba'i dpe mi rung ngo zhes zer na /
translated: This is explained as follows: Suppose you say, ‚ÄúThe one who is standing will rise and go at some point. Therefore the example of one who is not going is not suitable.‚Äù

translated: Well then, it is also suitable for us to argue and investigate in the following way: ‚ÄúAs long as the one who is sitting is not standing, for that long, the goer does not exist.‚ÄùüîΩTherefore, we do not use the example of the one who is sitting when he stands and goes.

analyzed: des ji srid du sdod cing mi 'gro ba de nyid dper byas pas kho bo'i dpe ma grub pa'i skyon med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: We use the very example of the one who is sitting and not going. Therefore, we are not at fault in that our example is not established. This is the meaning of the above passage.

original: mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to summarize the above and to demonstrate the result of valid knowledge, he says:

original: de'i phyir gal te de lta na 'di la 'gro zhes bya ba'i tha snyad 'ga' yang mi 'thad pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te de lta na 'di la 'gro zhes bya ba'i tha snyad 'ga' yang mi 'thad pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: Therefore, if it is like that, since the convention ‚Äúhe goes here‚Äù is not tenable in any way,

analyzed: des na des de dang ldan pa'i tha snyad yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: then the meaning of the reason, ‚Äúbecause the convention that possesses it exists,‚Äù is not established.

original: dpe yang med de bsgrub par bya ba chos dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dpe yang med de bsgrub par bya ba chos dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: There is no example because the predicate of the probandum is not established.

analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i rigs pa des na sngar 'gro ba smra ba dag gis smras pa /

translated: ‚ÄúListen to this other proof of going: Going definitely exists because the convention of one who possesses it exists.

analyzed: 'di na gang yang med pa la ni des de dang ldan pa mi ston te /
translated: Here, one who does not exist at all is not said to possess it,

analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rva can zhes mi ston pa bzhin no //
translated: just as one who possesses the horns of a rabbit is not indicated.üîΩSince the convention of one who possesses it exists, as in Devadatta goes, going exists. Therefore the intended meaning is established.‚Äù

original: lhas byin 'gro'o zhes 'gro bas de dang ldan pa'i tha snyad 'di yod pas des na 'gro ba yod pa'i phyir bsams pa'i don 'grub po zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs dang dpe ma grub pas bsams pa'i don mi 'grub po //
analyzed: lhas byin 'gro'o zhes 'gro bas de dang ldan pa'i tha snyad 'di yod pas des na 'gro ba yod pa'i phyir bsams pa'i don 'grub po zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs dang dpe ma grub pas bsams pa'i don mi 'grub po //
translated: Since the reason and example are not established, the intended meaning is not established.

analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid kyang yin no zhes bya ba ni gal te kun rdzob tu 'gro ba po sdod pa po la 'gro ba med pas khyab pa de la khyod mi 'gro bar sgrub na ni /
translated: The meaning of the reason is contradictory.üîΩIf you prove that the goer does not go because going and the goer are contradictory, then you contradict your own position that the goer goes.

original: des na khyod nyid 'gro ba yod par sgrub pa dang 'gal ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: des na khyod nyid 'gro ba yod par sgrub pa dang 'gal ba nyid yin no //

analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir ji ltar 'gro ba'i mi mthun pa 'gro ba po dang 'gro ba po ma yin pa dang / de las gzhan pa la mi 'thad pa dang / 'gro ba'i rtsom pa yang song ba dang ma song ba dang bgom pa la mi 'thad pa dang / 'gro ba'i ldog pa yang song ba dang ma song ba dang bgom pa la mi 'thad pa de bzhin du / sdod pa'i mi mthun pa yang sdod pa po dang sdod pa po ma yin pa dang de las gzhan pa la mi 'thad pa dang / sdod pa'i 'jug pa yang bsdad pa dang ma bsdad pa dang / sdod pa la mi 'thad pa dang sdod pa'i ldog pa yang bsdad pa dang ma bsdad pa dag /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it is untenable that the opposite of going belongs to the goer, to that which is not a goer, or to that which is different from those two, and it is untenable that the beginning of going belongs to that gone over, to that not gone over, or to that being gone over.üîΩSimilarly, it is untenable that the opposite of resting belongs to the one who is resting, to the one who is not resting, or to that which is different from those two, and it is untenable that the engagement of resting belongs to that which is already rested on, that which is not already rested on, or that which is being rested on, and it is untenable that the reversal of resting belongs to that which is already rested on or that which is not already rested on.üîΩIn that case, one should extensively infer that it is untenable that the opposite of going belongs to the goer, to that which is not a goer, or to that which is different from those two, and it is untenable that the beginning of going belongs to that gone over, to that not gone over, or to that being gone over.

original: sdod pa la mi 'thad pa de ltar rjes su dpag pa rgyas par bya'o zhes bya ba smras so //üîΩ'di skad bstan te /

analyzed: gsum pa gang zhig sdod par 'gyur // zhes bya ba ji ltar 'gro ba po mi sdod de sdod pa dang / 'gro ba gnyis mi mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa de @257b bzhin du sdod pa po yang mi 'gro ste /

translated: There is no beginning of going where one has gone,üîΩnor where one has not gone.üîΩThere is no beginning of going where one

translated: goes.

original: tshig mangs kyis dogs pa'i phyir dang / don bshad zin pa'i phyir spros pa'i sgo nas ma bshad de zhes bya ba ni sdod pa'i mi mthun pa yang sdod pa po dang / sdod pa po yang ma yin pa dang / de las gzhan pa la mi 'thad pa dang /

translated: Because of fear of verbosity and because the meaning has already been explained, I have not explained it by way of elaboration.üîΩThe non-establishment of the opposite of staying is the non-establishment of the stayer, the non-establishment of that which is not the stayer, and the non-establishment of that which is other than the stayer.üîΩThe non-establishment of the engagement of staying is the non-establishment of staying in that which is already stayed, that which is not yet stayed, and that which is staying.üîΩThe non-establishment of the disengagement of staying is the non-establishment of staying in that which is already stayed, that which is not yet stayed, and that which is staying.

translated: I have not explained these by way of elaboration in the form of an application of the extensive inferences.

analyzed: 'on kyang phyogs tsam zhig bshad par @258a * // bya'o zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: 'dir sbyor ba'i tshig tu 'gyur ba ni /

analyzed: bsdad pa la sdod pa'i 'jug pa med de bsdad zin pa'i phyir /

translated: By the power of that meaning of the words, the goer and going are not the same.

translated: Since they are not different in the sense of being empty of mutual ability, your criticism is not good.üîΩAnd that is well known in the world, since the manifest cutter and the manifest cut are different.üîΩThat difference is well known in the world, since the nature of the manifest cutter and the manifest cut are different.
